answers.answer: Hello, Swollen lymph nodes can be an indicator of infection in the body, and other issues as well.   For the constipation issue start taking Peri-Colace (they are red tablets)  Walmart has a good generic version cheap.  Take 3 nightly to start once you get more regular decrease to 2 nightly, if stool is to loose decrease to 1 nightly and increase and decrease from 3 to 1 as needed. Constipation can cause the stomach issues, so I recommend getting that under control and going from there.  If you see blood in the stool or continue to have pain etc.  you need to be checked out by a doctor.  Since you don't have medical insurance or can't afford to go maybe you can make an appointment at your local health department.  Also some not all local hospitals have a program available to help with labs etc that you may need along the way.   The swollen lymph nodes, pain,  and constipation can also indicate cancer which needs to be diagnosed and treatment started immediately if present.  I Hope This Helps Hun, and Good Luck!

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!A lump in armpit can be a swollen lymphnode, in response to fungal infection or sweat dermatitis or infection of hair follicles. It can also be an enlarged lymphnode due to malignancy of breast. At times it is a cyst too and this can get infected. Lipoma is also a possibility. Consult your PCP for an evaluation. A CT scan can be confirmatory or a fine needle biopsy. Treatment can vary from wait and watch to anti-inflammatory along with antibiotics to excision of the lump. Check for diabetes too as high sugar often results in repeated infection and boils.Chronic constipation can be due to diet poor in roughage or fiber and also due to dehydration. A high roughage with low water too could be a cause.  Diabetes and hypothyroidism, colon disorders, irritable bowel syndrome, diverticular diseases, cancers, severe acidity etc can all cause constipation. It can also be due to milk allergy and other food allergies. Since your sister has gained weight, hypothyroidism and diabetes, both of which slow down the gut and cause all water to be absorbed from the stool should be looked into.Please consult your PCP for primary examination followed by proper referral. Take care!
